bibl.title: A Bronze Thymiaterion in the Tanta Museum.
bibl.note: Tanta Museum, Inv. 3369. Bronze, H. 17,7 cm. The thymiaterion represents an actor sitting atop an altar, wearing a comic mask of a slave with open mouth intended as an outlet for perfumed incense. - Sais (E.A.O. excavations, 1988-1989), c. 25 B.C. - 50 A.D.
bibl.seg: EL GHANNAM Wafaa, A Bronze Thymiaterion in the Tanta Museum.

Tanta Museum, Inv. 3369. Bronze, H. 17,7 cm. The thymiaterion represents an actor sitting atop an altar, wearing a comic mask of a slave with open mouth intended as an outlet for perfumed incense. - Sais (E.A.O. excavations, 1988-1989), c. 25 B.C. - 50 A.D.
